item.title: My Experience With JSNAD
item.description: What Is OpenJS Node.js Application Developer (JSNAD)? JSNAD is a certification offered by Linux Foundation that verifies candidate’s skill in using Node.js to build applications of any kind. Unlike many other certifications, this is not a quiz in which you pick a correct answer from a given list of options. It is a practical exam in which you connect to a remote computer and write real code to solve various programming problems.

item.title: Introducing GHAST Stack
item.description: GHAST stack is a new tech-stack for developing web applications without excessive use of Javascript. In this article I describe why I am suggesting usage of this tech-stack and what technologies it uses.
